description: OneDrive is Microsoft’s cloud storage solution enabling users to store, sync, and share files across devices, offering offline access, real-time collaboration, and enterprise-grade security

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_COPY_ITEM
tools.description: Tool to copy a DriveItem (file or folder) to a new location asynchronously. Use when you need to duplicate an item, optionally renaming it or specifying a different parent folder. The operation is asynchronous; the response provides a URL to monitor the copy progress.

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name for the copied item. If not provided, the original name is used.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The ID of the DriveItem to be copied.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The ID of the site if the item is in a SharePoint site.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user if accessing another user's drive.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The ID of the drive where the item is located. If not provided, 'me' (user's default drive) is assumed.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The ID of the group if the item is in a group drive.

children_only.title: Children Only
children_only.description: If set to true, only the children of the source driveItem (if it's a folder) are copied, not the driveItem itself. Defaults to false. Cannot be used with name parameter.

parent_reference.title: CopyItemParentReference

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the parent item.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The ID of the drive that contains the parent item.

parent_reference.description: Reference to the parent item (folder) where the copy will be created. If not provided, the item is copied to the same folder as the original.

include_all_version_history.title: Include All Version History
include_all_version_history.description: If set to true, the version history of the source file is copied to the destination. Defaults to false.

@microsoft.graph.conflictBehavior.title: @Microsoft.Graph.Conflict Behavior
@microsoft.graph.conflictBehavior.description: Specifies how to handle a naming conflict if an item with the same name already exists in the destination. 'fail' (default), 'replace', or 'rename'.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_CREATE_LINK
tools.description: Tool to create a sharing link for a DriveItem (file or folder) by its unique ID. Use when you need to generate a shareable link for an item in OneDrive or SharePoint.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of sharing link to create.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description: The scope of the link to create. If not specified, the default link type for the organization is created.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive item (file or folder) for which to create the link.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the site. Use this if the item is in a SharePoint site's drive.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user. Use this if the item is in another user's drive.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. If not provided, the link will be created in the current user's drive (me/drive).

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group. Use this if the item is in a group's drive.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password for the sharing link. Optional and OneDrive Personal only.

expiration_date_time.title: Expiration Date Time
expiration_date_time.description: The expiration date and time for the permission, in yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. Example: 2023-12-31T23:59:59Z

retain_inherited_permissions.title: Retain Inherited Permissions
retain_inherited_permissions.description: If true (default), existing inherited permissions are retained. If false, all existing permissions are removed when sharing for the first time.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_DELETE_ITEM
tools.description: Tool to delete a DriveItem (file or folder) by its unique ID from the authenticated user's OneDrive. Use when you need to remove an item from OneDrive. This action moves the item to the recycle bin, not permanently deleting it.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the DriveItem (file or folder) to be deleted.

if_match.title: If Match
if_match.description: (Optional) If this request header is included and the eTag (or cTag) provided doesn't match the current tag on the item, a `412 Precondition Failed` response is returned, and the item won't be deleted.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_DOWNLOAD_FILE
tools.description: Downloads a file from a user's OneDrive using its item ID, which must refer to a file and not a folder.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: Unique ID of the file to download; must be a file, not a folder.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's ID or User Principal Name (UPN), or 'me' for the authenticated user's OneDrive.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: Desired filename (including extension) for the downloaded content.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_DRIVE
tools.description: Retrieves the properties and relationships of a Drive resource by its unique ID. Use this action when you need to get details about a specific OneDrive, user's OneDrive, group's document library, or a site's document library.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. This can be the ID of the user's personal OneDrive, a group's document library, or a specific drive ID.

select_fields.title: Select Fields
select_fields.description: A comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. Use this to retrieve specific fields and reduce the response size. For example, "id,name,driveType". If not provided, all default properties are returned.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_ITEM
tools.description: Retrieves the metadata of a DriveItem by its unique ID. Use this tool to get information about a specific file or folder in OneDrive when you have its ID. If a `drive_id` is not provided, it defaults to the user's main drive.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the DriveItem (file or folder).

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the Drive where the item is located. If not provided, the action will target the user's personal OneDrive (me/drive).

select_fields.title: Select Fields
select_fields.description: A list of DriveItem properties to return. If not specified, a default set of properties is returned. Refer to the DriveItem resource documentation for available fields.

expand_relations.title: Expand Relations
expand_relations.description: A list of relationships to expand in the response, such as 'children'.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_ITEM_PERMISSIONS
tools.description: Retrieves the permissions of a DriveItem by its unique ID or path within a specific Drive. Use when you need to check who has access to a file or folder and what level of access they have.

select.title: Select
select.description: A comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. For example, 'id,roles,link'.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive item.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of a SharePoint site. Use this if the item is in a SharePoint site's drive.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of a user. Use this if the item is in a specific user's drive (other than 'me').

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. Required if not using other identifiers like group_id, site_id, or user_id in the path.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of a group. Use this if the item is in a group's drive.

item_path.title: Item Path
item_path.description: The path to the item relative to the drive's root. Use this if item_id is not known. Must start with ':/' and end with ':/'. Example: ':/FolderA/FileB.txt:/'. Only applicable when accessing items in the current user's drive (me/drive/root).

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_ITEM_THUMBNAILS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve the thumbnails associated with a DriveItem. Use when you need to display visual previews of files.

select.title: Select
select.description: A comma-separated list of thumbnail sizes to retrieve (e.g., "small,medium,large", or "c300x400_crop"). If not specified, all available thumbnails for the first thumbnailSet (id: "0") are returned.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the DriveItem.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of a Site. Provide either drive_id, group_id, site_id, or user_id.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of a User. Provide either drive_id, group_id, site_id, or user_id.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the Drive. If not provided, 'me' will be used for the current user's drive.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of a Group. Provide either drive_id, group_id, site_id, or user_id.

original_orientation.title: Original Orientation
original_orientation.description: If true, retrieves the thumbnail with its original EXIF orientation. This is only supported on OneDrive Personal. Defaults to false.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_ITEM_VERSIONS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve the version history of a DriveItem by its unique ID. Use when you need to access or list previous versions of a file.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the item (file or folder).

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the site. Mutually exclusive with drive_id, group_id, and user_id.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user. Mutually exclusive with drive_id, group_id, and site_id.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. Mutually exclusive with group_id, site_id, and user_id. One of these must be provided if not using the /me path.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group. Mutually exclusive with drive_id, site_id, and user_id.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_QUOTA
tools.description: Tool to retrieve the quota information for the authenticated user's OneDrive. Use this action to check the storage space details like total, used, and remaining space on the user's OneDrive.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_RECENT_ITEMS
tools.description: Get files and folders recently accessed by the user. Returns items based on activity history (opened, edited, viewed), sorted by most recent first. Use when you need to see what the user worked on recently (e.g., 'Show me files I worked on today'). Different from search - this tracks activity, not content.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of recent items to return (1-200). Controls response size for better performance. Use pagination with @odata.nextLink for larger datasets.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. Significantly reduces payload size by returning only specified fields. Common properties: id, name, webUrl, size, lastModifiedDateTime, lastAccessedDateTime, file, folder, parentReference. If not specified, all properties are returned (large payload).

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_SHARED_ITEMS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of items that have been shared with the authenticated user. Use this action to get details of files and folders shared with the current user.

allow_external.title: Allow External
allow_external.description: Set to true to include items shared from external tenants. Defaults to false, which only returns items shared within the user's own tenant.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_SHAREPOINT_LIST_ITEMS
tools.description: Tool to get the items (list items) within a specific SharePoint list on a site. Use when you need to retrieve data from a SharePoint list.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: A comma-separated list of relationships to expand, or 'fields($select=columnName1,columnName2)' to retrieve specific fields. For example, to get specific columns 'Name' and 'Color', use 'fields($select=Name,Color)'.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: An OData filter query to restrict the results. For example, to filter items where 'Quantity' is less than 600, use 'fields/Quantity lt 600'.

select.title: Select
select.description: A comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. Often used in conjunction with '$expand=fields(select=...)'. For example, 'id,name,fields'.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique identifier of the list within the SharePoint site.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_SITE_DETAILS
tools.description: Retrieves metadata for a specific SharePoint site by its ID. Use this action when you need to get details like display name, web URL, and creation/modification dates for a known SharePoint site.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site. This is the id property of the site resource.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_GET_SITE_PAGE_CONTENT
tools.description: Gets the content of a modern SharePoint site page. Use when you need to retrieve the details and content of a specific page within a SharePoint site.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Expands related entities. For example, use 'canvasLayout' to include the page's layout and web part content.

page_id.title: Page Id
page_id.description: The unique identifier of the site page.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_INVITE_USER_TO_DRIVE_ITEM
tools.description: Tool to invite users or grant permissions to a specific item in a OneDrive drive. Use when you need to share a file or folder with other users and define their access level (e.g., read or write).

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: Specifies the roles to be granted to the recipients.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive item (file or folder).

message.title: Message
message.description: A plain text formatted message that is included in the sharing invitation. Maximum length 2000 characters.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of a SharePoint site. Use this if the item is in a SharePoint site's drive.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of a user. Use this if the item is in another user's drive that you have access to.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. If not provided, the authenticated user's personal drive (me/drive) will be used.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of a Microsoft 365 group. Use this if the item is in a group's drive.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password set on the invite by the creator. Optional and OneDrive Personal only.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: The alias of the recipient, if a personal Microsoft Account.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the recipient.

object_id.title: Object Id
object_id.description: The object ID of the recipient, if a user or group in Azure AD.

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: A collection of recipients who will receive access and the sharing invitation.

require_sign_in.title: Require Sign In
require_sign_in.description: Specifies whether the recipient of the invitation is required to sign-in to view the shared item. At least one of require_sign_in or send_invitation must be true.

send_invitation.title: Send Invitation
send_invitation.description: If true, a sharing link is sent to the recipient. Otherwise, a permission is granted directly without sending a notification.

expiration_date_time.title: Expiration Date Time
expiration_date_time.description: Specifies the dateTime after which the permission expires. ISO 8601 format. Example: "2023-12-31T23:59:59.000Z"

retain_inherited_permissions.title: Retain Inherited Permissions
retain_inherited_permissions.description: Optional. If true (default), any existing inherited permissions are retained on the shared item when sharing this item for the first time. If false, all existing permissions are removed when sharing for the first time.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_DRIVE_ITEM_ACTIVITIES
tools.description: Tool to list recent activities for a specific item in a OneDrive drive. Use when you need to track changes or actions performed on a file or folder.

$top.title: $Top
$top.description: Show only the first n items.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the driveItem.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_DRIVES
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of Drive resources available to the authenticated user, or for a specific user, group, or site. Use when you need to find out what drives are accessible.

inputSchema.title: ListDrivesRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: The maximum number of items to return in a single page. Must be between 1 and 999.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to expand (e.g., "root,list").

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., "id,name,driveType").

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: A comma-separated list of properties to order the results by, optionally followed by "asc" or "desc" (e.g., "name desc").

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The ID of the site to list drives for. If provided, group_id and user_id should not be used.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user to list drives for. If provided, group_id and site_id should not be used. If none of group_id, site_id, or user_id are provided, the drives for the current authenticated user (/me/drives) will be listed.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The ID of the group to list drives for. If provided, site_id and user_id should not be used.

skip_token.title: Skip Token
skip_token.description: A token used to retrieve the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing OneDrive drives.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_ROOT_DRIVE_CHANGES
tools.description: Tool to list changes in the root of the user's primary drive using a delta token. Use when you need to track file and folder modifications, additions, or deletions in the main OneDrive directory.

token.title: Token
token.description: A string token that represents the state of the drive from a previous call. It can be a deltaLink from a previous response, the literal string 'latest' to get a token for future calls without enumerating current items, or omitted to get all current items and a nextLink or deltaLink.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SHAREPOINT_LIST_ITEMS_DELTA
tools.description: Tool to track changes to items in a SharePoint list using a delta query. Use when you need to get newly created, updated, or deleted list items without performing a full read of the entire item collection.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of items to return in a single response.

token.title: Token
token.description: If unspecified or empty, enumerates the current state. If 'latest', returns an empty response with the latest delta token. If a previous delta token, returns changes since that token.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to expand. Use 'fields($select=ColumnA,ColumnB)' format for field selection.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of listItem properties to return.

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique identifier of the list within the site.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SITE_COLUMNS
tools.description: Tool to list all column definitions for a SharePoint site. Use this when you need to retrieve the schema or structure of columns within a specific SharePoint site.

top.title: Top
top.description: The maximum number of items to return.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Comma-separated list of related resources to expand in the response.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData filter expression to apply to the results.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: Comma-separated list of properties used to sort the results.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site. Example: `contoso.sharepoint.com,2C712604-133D-4A7C-9194-F53CE4C952A2,A704AEF5-C2C0-43C3-A3D8-9F55A73A02E2`

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SITE_DRIVE_ITEMS_DELTA
tools.description: Tool to track changes to DriveItems in the default document library of a SharePoint site. Use when you need to get a list of items that have been added, modified, or deleted since a previous state or to get an initial enumeration of all items.

token.title: Token
token.description: A token used to retrieve a specific page of results or to get changes since a previous state. Can be 'latest' to get the most recent delta token without items, a deltaLink URL, or a timestamp (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SITE_LISTS
tools.description: Tool to list all lists under a specific SharePoint site. Use when you need to enumerate lists within a known site.

top.title: Top
top.description: The maximum number of items to return.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to expand in the response. Example: columns,items

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. Example: id,name,list

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: OData order by expression. Example: name asc

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SITE_SUBSITES
tools.description: Tool to list all subsites of a SharePoint site. Use when you need to retrieve a collection of subsites for a given parent site.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the SharePoint site for which to list subsites.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_LIST_SUBSCRIPTIONS
tools.description: Tool to list the current subscriptions for the authenticated user or app. Use this to retrieve details of existing webhook subscriptions.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_MOVE_ITEM
tools.description: Tool to move a file or folder to a new parent folder in OneDrive. Use when you need to reorganize your files or folders by changing their location. You can optionally rename the item during the move.

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name for the DriveItem. If not provided, the item retains its original name.

itemId.title: Item Id
itemId.description: The unique identifier of the file or folder (DriveItem) to be moved.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The unique identifier of the Drive that contains the item. If not specified, it defaults to the user's personal drive (`/me/drive`).

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the new parent folder where the item will be moved.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The unique identifier of the Drive that contains the new parent folder. If not specified, it's assumed the parent folder is in the same drive as the item being moved.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_CREATE_FOLDER
tools.description: Creates a new folder in the user's OneDrive, automatically renaming on conflict, optionally within a specified parent_folder (by ID or full path from root) which, if not the root, must exist and be accessible.

name.title: Name
name.description: The desired name for the new folder. If a folder with this name already exists in the specified parent_folder, the new folder will be automatically renamed (e.g., 'New Folder' might become 'New Folder 1'). Examples: ['Annual Reports', 'Client Meeting Notes']

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifier for the user. This action operates on the currently authenticated user's OneDrive. Examples: ['me']

parent_folder.title: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: ID or full path of the parent folder for the new folder. Paths must start from the root (e.g., '/Documents/Reports'). If an ID is provided, it refers to an existing folder's unique ID. Examples: ['/Projects/Alpha', 'folder_id_12345ABC', '/']

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_CREATE_TEXT_FILE
tools.description: Creates a new text file with specified content in a OneDrive folder, using either the folder's unique ID or its absolute path (paths are automatically resolved to IDs); note that OneDrive may rename or create a new version if the filename already exists.

name.title: Name
name.description: The desired name for the new text file, including its extension (e.g., 'report.txt', 'notes.log').

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: The unique identifier (ID) or an absolute path of the OneDrive folder where the new text file will be created.

content.title: Content
examples: This is the content of the new text file.
TODO: Finalize the project proposal by EOD.
content.description: The plain text content to be written into the new file.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's ID or the literal 'me' to represent the currently authenticated user.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_FIND_FILE
tools.description: Non-recursively finds an item (file or folder) in a specified OneDrive folder; if `folder` is provided as a path, it must actually exist.

name.title: Name
name.description: The exact name of the file or folder to find within the specified `folder`.

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: The unique identifier (ID) or absolute path of the OneDrive folder for the search. For the root folder, use '/'. Paths must start with '/'.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user (e.g., a GUID) or the alias 'me' to represent the currently authenticated user. This determines whose OneDrive will be accessed.

include_metadata.title: Include Metadata
include_metadata.description: If set to true, the response will include the complete metadata for each found item. If false (default), only essential properties like id, name, and webUrl are returned.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_FIND_FOLDER
tools.description: Finds folders by name within an accessible parent folder in OneDrive, or lists all its direct child folders if no name is specified.

name.title: Name
name.description: Exact name of the folder to find. If omitted, all direct child folders of the parent `folder` are returned.

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: Path (e.g., '/My Files/Work', '/' for root) or unique ID of the parent folder where child folders are searched.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's unique identifier (e.g., email, UPN) or 'me' for the authenticated user, specifying the OneDrive account.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_LIST_ITEMS
tools.description: Retrieves all files and folders as `driveItem` resources from the root of a specified user's OneDrive, automatically handling pagination.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum items per API request, setting the batch size; the action automatically handles pagination to fetch all items. The Microsoft Graph API may limit this (e.g., to 999).

select.title: Select
select.description: Specifies `driveItem` properties to return. If omitted or empty, default properties are returned. Refer to Microsoft Graph API documentation for a complete list of `driveItem` properties.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's unique identifier (e.g., 'user@example.com', object ID) or 'me' for the authenticated user's OneDrive.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_ONEDRIVE_UPLOAD_FILE
tools.description: Uploads a file to a specified OneDrive folder, automatically renaming on conflict and supporting large files via chunking.

file.title: FileUploadable
file.description: The file to be uploaded, including its name and access to its binary content.

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: Destination folder path from root (e.g., '/Documents/Reports') or a unique folder ID.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User ID (e.g., user_principal_name, unique GUID) or 'me' for the authenticated user, determining the target OneDrive.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_PREVIEW_DRIVE_ITEM
tools.description: Generates or retrieves a short-lived embeddable URL for a preview of a specific item. Use when you need to display a temporary preview of a file.

page.title: Page
page.description: Optional. Page number of document to start at, if applicable. Specified as string for future use cases around file types such as ZIP.

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Optional. Zoom level to start at, if applicable.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the DriveItem.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the Site. Provide if the item is in a SharePoint site.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the User. Provide if the item is in another user's drive.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the Drive. If not provided, the request will be made to the current user's drive.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of the Group. Provide if the item is in a group drive.

share_id.title: Share Id
share_id.description: The unique identifier of the shared item. Provide if the item is accessed via a share link.

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_SEARCH_ITEMS
tools.description: Search OneDrive for files and folders by keyword. Searches filenames, metadata, and file content to find matching items. Use when you need to find specific files based on keywords, file types, or content (e.g., 'Find all PDFs containing budget'). Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination.

q.title: Q
q.description: The query text used to search for items. Values may be matched across several fields including filename, metadata, and file content.

top.title: Top
top.description: The maximum number of items to return in a single page. Default is 200.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: A comma-separated list of properties used to sort the order of the items in the response. Use 'asc' or 'desc' for ascending or descending order, e.g., 'name asc'.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The ID of the drive to search within. If not provided, the user's personal drive (me/drive) will be searched. Can also be a group ID, site ID, or user ID.

skip_token.title: Skip Token
skip_token.description: A token to retrieve the next page of results, obtained from the @odata.nextLink in a previous response.

search_scope.title: Search Scope
search_scope.description: Specifies the scope of the search. 'root' searches within a specific folder hierarchy (default if drive_id is specified for a drive item, or /me/drive/root). 'drive' broadens the search to include items shared with the current user (used with /me/drive/search).

tools.name: ONE_DRIVE_UPDATE_DRIVE_ITEM_METADATA
tools.description: Tool to update the metadata of a specific item (file or folder) in OneDrive. Use this to rename items, change descriptions, or move items to a new parent folder.

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name for the drive item.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive item (file or folder) to update.

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: The unique identifier of the site. Used when updating an item within a site's drive.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user. Used when updating an item within a specific user's drive.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The unique identifier of the drive. Required if not using other specific paths like /me, /groups/{group-id}, /sites/{site-id}, or /users/{user-id}.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group. Used when updating an item within a group's drive.

description.title: Description
description.description: The new description for the drive item.

parent_reference_id.title: Parent Reference Id
parent_reference_id.description: The ID of the new parent item. Use this to move the item. The driveId of the parentReference can also be specified if moving between drives.

additional_properties.title: Additional Properties
additional_properties.description: Allows passing any other updatable DriveItem properties not explicitly defined in the model.

parent_reference_drive_id.title: Parent Reference Drive Id
parent_reference_drive_id.description: The drive ID of the new parent item, if moving to a different drive.
